conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to analyze the motion of the cargo particle on the conveyor belt. The key is to determine the acceleration and distance traveled when the cargo reaches the same speed as the conveyor.
Identify the initial conditions: Length of the conveyor belt, L1 = 6 m; Speed of the conveyor, v0 = 2 m/s; Kinetic friction coefficient, μ1 = 0.2.

The acceleration a1 can be found using the formula: a1 = (v0 - u) / t, where u is the initial velocity of the cargo particle, v0 is the speed of the conveyor, and t is the time taken to reach the same speed.
Since the cargo is released from rest, u = 0. Therefore, a1 = v0 / t.
The distance traveled by the cargo when it reaches the same speed as the conveyor is s1 = L1. Using the formula for distance traveled: s1 = v0 × t, 6 = 2 × t, t = 3 seconds.
Substitute t = 3 seconds into the acceleration formula: a1 = 2 / 3 = 0.67 m/s^2.
Since the cargo travels the same distance as the conveyor, s1 = 6 m.
The total time t_total is the sum of the time taken to reach the same speed as the conveyor and the time taken to travel the distance s1: t_total = t + s1 = 3 + 6 = 9 seconds.
The total distance traveled by the cargo particle is s1 + L1 = 6 + 6 = 12 m.
